text: Dinizia jueirana-facao is a tree in the family Fabaceae which grows in a restricted area of rainforest in Espírito Santo state in Brazil. It was described by G. P. Lewis & G. S. Siqueira in 2004. Its specific name derives from its local name, "jueirana-facão". To date, there are less than 25 specimens in existence, making it critically endangered. == References == Category:Caesalpinioideae Category:Trees of Brazil Category:Critically endangered flora of South America
title: Dinizia jueirana-facao
